comments.content:
Interesting, hadn't seen that one before. It seems to be custom, but an actual custom font (not just the logo). After a bit of digging, I found one PDF on naturalizer.com that lists the fonts as "Naturalizer":  
 [http://www.naturalizer.com/App\_Themes/Default/pdf/check-your-size.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804040523/http:/www.naturalizer.com/App_Themes/Default/pdf/check-your-size.pdf "http://www.naturalizer.com/App\_Themes/Default/pdf/check-your-size.pdf")

Great snooping! Looks custom, and it's a clean and  
tasteful job. Nice to see. I'd love to know who did it.

hhp

Me too. It seems that Chicago-based GSP Marketing\* was in charge of the overall brand relaunch in 2005; but I can't find anything specific about the font (or the logo, for that matter).  
\* [http://gspmarketing.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804040523/http:/gspmarketing.com/ "http://gspmarketing.com/")

I'll send GSP a [properly-worded] email, and report back.

hhp

Looks like Ian Brignell's Naturalizer font  
 [http://www.ianbrignell.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804040523/http:/www.ianbrignell.com/ "http://www.ianbrignell.com/")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804040523im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_69_full_3947.gif)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804040523im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_203_full_5521.gif)
Just saw this on a shopping bag and it looks incredible.
